content.line: I am not better than my brother over the way,
But he hasa bird in a cage and I have not.

line.figLang: It beats its little fretted wings

content.line: Against the wires of its prison all day long.
While summer air is tender and the shadows of
And the earth is so cool and heated in spots,
And the air from rich herbage rises teeming,
And gold of suns spills all round,
And birds upon the oaks fly and sing and flutter.

line.figLang: And there is that little green prisoner,

content.line: Tossing its body forward and up,

line.figLang: I listen for its hungry little song,
Like drops of dew dispelled by drought.

content.line: O, rosebud doomed to ripen in a bud vase!
O, bird of song within that binding cage!
Nay, I am not better than my brother over the way,
Only he has a bird in a cage and I have not.
